question_sentence: Nato allies rejected Emmanuel Macron's idea of doing what?
choices: Increasing defence spending to 2.5% of members' GDP
evidence: The French president faced pushback from Nato allies after suggesting that boots on the ground in Ukraine should "not be ruled out" as the West must do "everything needed so Russia cannot win the war". The Kremlin warned that any deployment would "inevitably" lead to direct confrontation between Russia and the Western alliance.

question_sentence: Florida has been hit by an outbreak of which highly infectious disease?
evidence: Florida's state health department had reported 10 cases of the "highly contagious" virus as of Friday, and more states across the rest of the US are also reporting cases. The outbreaks have prompted experts to highlight insufficient vaccination rates.

question_sentence: The UK's equality watchdog warned that employers could be sued for failing to make "reasonable adjustments" for staff experiencing what?
evidence: According to controversial guidelines issued by the Equality and Human Rights Commission, menopause symptoms can be considered a disability if they have a "long-term and substantial impact" on someone's ability to carry out their usual day-to-day tasks. And failing to make "reasonable adjustments", which might include cooler rooms, breaks and flexible uniform policies, may amount to disability discrimination under the Equality Act 2010.

question_sentence: Which British racing driver launched an all-female karting championship to encourage more women to participate?
evidence: The three-time W Series champion and Indy NXT driver has teamed up with Daytona Motorsport to launch an all-female UK karting programme aimed at boosting female participation in motorsport at grass-roots levels. To find out more, listen toThe Week Unwrappedpodcast.

question_sentence: An event billed as "the most insane athletic showdown on Earth" was launched in which US state?
evidence: The inaugural "FloridaMan Games" took place last weekend, and featured events such as the Weaponised Pool Noodle Mud Duel, theFloridaSumo and an Eat the Butt contest.For more unusual news, subscribe to ourTall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: North Koreans working where have rioted over unpaid wages?
evidence: Thousands of North Koreans working illegally in China have reportedly rioted to demand years of unpaid wages alleged to have been spent on funding Pyongyang's war machine. North Koreans have also been sent to Russia, Poland, Qatar, Uruguay and Mali under a forced labour programme that dates back decades.

question_sentence: Who told a major gathering of American conservatives that both the US and UK need a "bigger bazooka" to fight the left?
evidence: Addressing an audience at the recent Conservative Political Action Conference in Maryland, the shortest-serving prime minister in UK history derided "wokenomics" and Joe Biden. Political pundits suggest that Truss is rebrandingherself in a bid to relaunch her stalled political career over in theUS.

question_sentence: A graffiti-covered skyscraper has become the newest landmark in which US city?
evidence: Graffiti artists have spray-painted colourful tags across multiple floors of the city's abandoned Oceanwide Plaza skyscraper development, which gained global attention after this year's Grammys were held at a neighbouring venue. The 53-storey building has become a site for social media stunts and triggered debate over the value of artistry versus vandalism.

question_sentence: Renée Zellweger is set to reprise her film role as who?
evidence: Double Oscar winner Zellwegerwill play Helen Fielding's heroine once again in a fourth film in the hit series. "Bridget Jones: Mad About the Boy" will begin filming in May and is also expected to star Colin Firth and Hugh Grant, who played love rivals Mark Darcy and Daniel Cleaver in the previous movies.

question_sentence: What is the name of the project that uses AI to recreate the voices of gun violence victims?
evidence: The project is a collaboration by parents of gun violence victims who are campaigning for gun control legislation. Created by advocacy groups Change the Ref and March for Our Lives, The Shotline uses the AI-generated voices of the young victims to record messages urging Congress to pass the necessary laws.

question_sentence: What prompted widespread evacuations across the Texas Panhandle this week?
evidence: Deadly wildfires torched more than 1 million acres in northern Texas and neighboring Oklahoma towns. Many of the blazes are far from being contained. (Image credit: Patrick Ryan/Reuters)

question_sentence: Which major city may be just months away from running out of water?
evidence: Due to abnormally low rainfall, Mexico City may be just months away from “day zero” — when the taps run dry for huge swaths of the city. (Image credit: Henry Romero/Reuters)

question_sentence: Fresh vegetables are starting to come at a premium at US grocery stores. Which vegetable notched a significant price increase this year?
evidence: The most notable price increase in produce aisles this year was for tomatoes, which cost 4.6% more in January than in December. Meanwhile, the US government on Monday sued to block a $25 billion deal between Kroger and Albertsons, alleging the largest supermarket merger in US history would drive grocery costs even higher. (Image credit: Scott Olson/Getty Images)

question_sentence: President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump planned dueling trips this week to which region?
evidence: Biden and Trump planned trips to the southern US border on the same day, setting up a split screen between the likely 2024 presidential candidates as immigration takes center stage ahead of the November election. (Image credit: John Moore/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled more than 380,000 pickup trucks this week?
evidence: Toyota announced a recall of many newer Tacoma pickup trucks because bolts in the axles could loosen and fall off. (Image credit: jetcityimage/iStock Editorial/Getty Images/File)

question_sentence: How many days are in the 2024 calendar year?
evidence: There are 366 days this year. February 29 is a leap day that occurs every four years to keep our calendar in sync with the seasons. (Image credit: Jenny Kane/AP)

question_sentence: Which city has been inundated by a swarm of mosquitoes?
evidence: Buenos Aires, Argentina, is covered in mosquitoes following a stretch of heavy rainfall. (Image credit: Luis Robayo/AFP/Getty Images)

question_sentence: The Albert Einstein College of Medicine in New York received a “transformational” donation this week in what amount?
evidence: Students will receive free tuition after the school was gifted $1 billion by a former faculty member. (Image credit: Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which fast food chain upset many customers this week after announcing it would introduce what appeared to be Uber-like surge pricing on its menu?
evidence: Wendy’s explained in a Tuesday blog post that its test of new menus with prices that change throughout the day is not meant to cost more for customers. (Image credit: Kena Betancur/VIEWpress/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which singer announced she is postponing several upcoming 2024 tour dates after falling ill?
evidence: Adele announced she is postponing the upcoming dates of her Las Vegas residency to “rest thoroughly.” (Image credit: Kevin Mazur/Getty Images)

question_sentence: What recent court ruling is the Delaware Attorney General, Kathy Jennings, planning to appeal?
choices: A ruling that upheld the state’s systems for early voting and permanent absentee voter registration.
A ruling that expanded the state’s systems for early voting and permanent absentee voter registration.
A ruling that restricted the state’s systems for early voting and permanent absentee voter registration.

question_sentence: What is the most expensive Airbnb rental in Delaware according to a report by financial securities trading company BestBrokers?
choices: A beachfront property in Dewey Beach for $4,000 per night
A luxury villa in Wilmington for $4,500 per night
A luxury villa in Wilmington for $5,500 per night

question_sentence: Which Delaware museum won the 2024 USA TODAY 10Best Readers’ Choice Award in the Best Open Air Museums category?
What is the name of the character Aubrey Plaza hopes to play in John Waters’ new film “Liarmouth”?
What were two of the challenges faced by firefighters while tackling the early morning fire in Glasgow?
choices: The house was located in a remote area and fallen wires
There was a lack of nearby fire hydrants and flooding
The fire was caused by a gas leak

question_sentence: What is the name of the tournament being hosted by Mid-County Lanes & Entertainment, which is also Delaware’s first major PBA Tour stop?
What is the special product that The Frozen Farmer, in partnership with Mattel Inc., has recently launched?
What recent event at St. Elizabeth Catholic School has caused the community to demand answers?
choices: The school won a national award
The school introduced a new curriculum
The school was closed due to a natural disaster

question_sentence: What is the purpose of House Bill 300, one of the bills in the legislative package introduced to reform Delaware’s long-term care industry?
choices: To double the fines for long-term care facilities
To increase the frequency of in-person inspections of assisted-living facilities and nursing homes.
To create a career-based scholarship program for nursing students.

question_sentence: What happened to Delaware home sales and the median price in January 2024?
choices: Home sales decreased, median price increased
Home sales increased, median price decreased
Both home sales and median price decreased
